noun.description: The combination of characteristics or qualities that form an individual's distinctive character.
examples: she had a sunny personality that was very engaging
she has triumphed by sheer force of personality
each brand of gin has its own personality

noun.description: A famous person, especially in entertainment or sports.
examples: an official opening by a famous personality

noun.description: The quality or fact of being a person as distinct from a thing or animal.

origin: Late Middle English (in personality (sense 3)): from Old French personalite, from medieval Latin personalitas, from Latin personalis of a person (see personal). personality (sense 1) dates from the late 18th century.
